intro: Hieracium argentinense var. sublorentzianum, commonly known as the Argentine hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. This variant is native to South America, particularly Argentina, and thrives in grassy or disturbed habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and produces numerous small, dandelion-like flowers. It is often found in open areas with well-drained soil, and its growth is influenced by seasonal rainfall patterns.
